class_notes:
Course Topic: Savage: Disrespectable Black Women Artists


"And my momma was a savage, I got this sh*t from Tina." In this course, we will explore the ways popular artists like Megan thee Stallion and Beyonc√© exist in the legacy of defiant and self-definitional Black women artists spanning the 20th century like Ma Rainey, Zora Neale Hurston, Nina Simone and Toni Morrision. This course will ask students to read novels, poetry, films, and music videos, analyzing themes like self-definition, collaboration, and sensual expression as meaningful components of Black feminist praxis. The texts will include works like Their Eyes Were Watching God, Sula, 'Four Women,' and 'Ego-Trippin.' Assignments will include weekly discussion posts, a research paper, and a final creative project.
course_description: An exploration of the connections between literature and various other mimetic and expressive arts, including painting, film, theater, music, sculpture, architecture, and dance.
